topic.title: HPE Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade 2.0 Post-Alpha Release Build 22: Installation Prerequisites

body.p: This document describes the prerequisite steps and one time setup on your HLM host required to install HPE Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade in a baremetal environment.

section.title: Hardware and software requirements
section.p: Before you start, if you have not done so already, make sure your environment meets the hardware and software requirements. See the HP Helion OpenStack Support Matrix.

section.title: Preparing the HLM host
section.p: Perform the following tasks on the HLM host:

li.xref: Download the installation packages for the KVM region

section.title: Install Ubuntu Server 14.04.2 LTS
section.p: The HLM host must have Ubuntu Server 14.04.2 LTS installed before performing the HPE Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade installation.

section.title: Configure proxy information
section.p: Before you begin your installation on the HLM host, configure the proxy information for your environment using the following steps:

ol.li: Launch a terminal and log in to your HLM host as root:sudo su -

Edit the /etc/environment file to add the following lines, using values specific to your environment. the export no-proxy command is optional:PATH="/usr/local/sbin:/usr/local/bin:/usr/sbin:/usr/bin:/sbin:/bin:/usr/games:/usr/local/games" export http_proxy=http://<web_proxy_IP>/ export https_proxy=http://<web_proxy_IP>/ export no_proxy=localhost,127.0.0.1,<HLM_host_IP_address>,<provider_network>
Where:<web_proxy_IP> is your web proxy IP address. <HLM_host_IP_address> is the IP address of the HLM Host

section.title: Install Ubuntu packages
section.p: Before starting the installation, you must install the following packages on the KVM host.
To install the packages on the KVM host:

ol.li: On the KLM host, run the following all in one command to install packages: sudo su -l -c "apt-get install -y ntp firefox gedit xrdp xfce4 qemu-kvm libvirt-bin openvswitch-switch openvswitch-common python-libvirt qemu-system-x86 libssl-dev libffi-dev git python-virtualenv python-dev virt-manager xorg gnome-core gnome-system-tools gnome-app-install sshpass gnupg jq vlan sudo ansible
Add the 802.1q module to the kernel on boot. The 802.1q standard supports VLAN tagging on an ethernet network.sudo su -c 'echo "8021q" >> /etc/modules'
Log out and re-login to the HLM host to activate the proxy configuration.

section.title: Configure the XRDP remote desktop display
section.p: Configure XRDP on the KVM host for the remote desktop connection to access the server remotely as follows.

ol.li:
Edit the sesman.ini file: vi /etc/xrdp/sesman.ini
Update theMaxSessions=1 to MaxSessions=50.
Save and close the file.
Configure the system to use XRDP:echo "xfce4-session" > ~/.xinitrc
Restart the XDRP service: sudo /etc/init.d/xrdp restart

section.p: If the XDRP display does not work as expected, (you see a gray screen), update the startwm.sh file:

codeblock.codeph:
vi /etc/xrdp/startwm.sh
#!/bin/sh
if [ -r /etc/default/locale ]; then . /etc/default/locale export LANG LANGUAGE fi
#. /etc/X11/Xsession . /usr/bin/startxfce4

section.title: Install and configure NTP
section.p: You must configure the HLM Host as an NTP client.
You can install NTP on the HLM host and configure it as an NTP server. Or, you can use a pre-existing NTP server that is reachable from the management network.
For information on configuring the HLM host as an NTP client, see .
For information on installing NTP on the HLM host, see Installing an NTP Server.

section.title: Configure SSH
section.p: On the HLM host, the OpenSSH server must be running and the firewall configuration should allow access to the SSH ports.

ol.li: Enable root login in the /etc/ssh/sshd_config by setting the following values and save the file: # Authentication: LoginGraceTime 120 #PermitRootLogin without-password PermitRootLogin yes #StrictModes yes StrictModes no PermitRootLogin yes
Disable strict host key checking: in the ~/.ssh/config file (create the file if it does not exist) add following lines and save the file: Host * StrictHostKeyChecking no
Restart the SSH service:service ssh restart

Configure the public key and passwordless SSH access.
a. Enter the following command:ssh-keygen -t rsa
b. Press Enter to use default path (/root/.ssh/id_rsa)
c. Press Enter when prompted for the passphrase.
d. Press enter again to confirm the empty passphrase.
The output of the public key will display, similar to the following:ssh-copy-id 192.168.122.1
If you get a permission denied error, make sure you are logged in as root.

section.title: Preparing the Network for Installation
section.p: Before installing HPE Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade, you are responsible for preparing the network for all installations.
See Preparing the Network for Installation

section.title: Integrating LDAP
section.p: OPTIONAL: The HPE Helion OpenStack Identity service can use Lightweight Directory Access Protocol (LDAP) to integrate your organization's existing directory service and user account management processes.

section.title: Download and unpack the installation packages
section.p: Before you begin, you must download the required HPE Helion OpenStack installation package(s). For the 10/16 POC release, the installation packages are located using FTP at HPE Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade V2.0 Alpha Build 22. HPE internal network access is required.http://16.78.71.141/uploads/hcg-2-0-alpha/build22.tar

The FTP download, build22.tar, contains all of the files you will need to install and configure HPE Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade. This is a large file that might take a significant amount of time to download, depending upon the speed of your network.
Note: For KVM + ESX Cloud Deployments, you will need to obtain the and install the VMware ESX and HPE Distributed Cloud Networking (DCN) software through those entities.

p.b: HPE Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade installation files

section.p: The build22.tar file contains the installation files for HPE Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade in the build22/HLM/ directory. The installation instructions indicate when and how to deploy the patches:
The build22.tar file contains the required patches in the build22/HLM/patches directory. The installation instructions indicate when and how to deploy the patches.
The build22.tar file contains the required DCN packages needed to deploy the DCN environment, in the build22/HLM/DCN directory. The current supported version is DCN version 3.2 R4.

The build22.tar file contains the following files requried to install the KVM region of HPE Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade, in the build22/WR/ directory. The installation instructions indicate when and how to deploy the patches
The following files are included in the installation download packages and will become available during the installation of Helion Lifecycle Management (HLM).

ul.li: license.lic Located in the /root/cg-hlm/windriver-files directory on the HLM host.
region_config Located in the /var/hlm/clouds/<cloud-name>/desired_state/<cloud-name>/001/base/stage/windriver-config directory on the HLM host.
cakey.pem Located in the /var/hlm/clouds/<cloud-name>/desired_state/<cloud-name>/001/base/stage/windriver-config directory on the HLM host.

section.p: You can download these files to any location. You will copy these files to the /home/wrsroot/ directory of controller-0 in the KVM region during the installation process.

section.title: Download the ESX packages for KVM + ESX
section.p: Note: This is applicable only for KVM + ESX Cloud Deployment.
To integrate VMware ESX storage, deploy the KVM + ESX topology, download the following additional packages.
Download all required ESX packages needed to deploy the ESX environment, including the VMware vSphere Distributed Switch (VDS) .

section.title: Verify the downloaded checksums
section.p: You should also use a checksum verification tool, such as sha256sum, which should come installed with Ubuntu.

section.title: Bring Up Single VSD VM Manually
section.p: Note: This is applicable only for KVM + ESX Cloud Deployment.
You must launch a virtual machine for the required HPE DCN Virtualized Services Directory (VSD) and create required users.
For more information, see Bringing Up Single VSD VM Manually.

section.title: Prepare the baremetal systems
section.p: Perform the following tasks on each server you will use as a compute server or controller in the non-KVM and KVM regions:

ul.li:
Configure the boot order with Network/PXE boot as the first option:
For example, to set the boot order for a HPE SL390, from the iLO prompt enter set system1/bootconfig1/bootsource5 bootorder=1.
to the correct date and time
with only one network interface enabled for PXE/network boot and any additional interfaces should have PXE/network boot disabled
to stay powered off in the event of being shutdown rather than automatically restarting

li.p: Update to the latest firmware recommended by the system vendor for all system components, including the BIOS, BMC firmware, disk controller firmware, drive firmware, network adapter firmware, and so forth.
Note: If you are using ProLiant Gen9 blades or rack servers, you must update the Snap3 firmware.
